If we are not quick to confront these problems and make the necessary adjustments, millions more Americans will find themselves being taken advantage of.  There is only one problem with that‚Ä¶

From 2016-2017 the @CFPB saw student loan complaints skyrocket 325%, meaning problems with these student loan servicers seem to be getting significantly worse. 
https://www.forbes.com/sites/zackfriedman/2017/06/23/student-loan-complaints/#12c4d2d1533b
https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/18/business/student-loans-licenses.html?_r=1

In many states, gov agencies can seize state-issued professional licenses from residents who default on their educational debts, making it nearly impossible for people to get work and pay back their student debt. In one state, they can even suspend a person‚Äôs driver‚Äôs license!
This leaves students trapped under a mountain of piling debt with little they can do to ever escape. But it gets even worse!

One of the biggest problems with student loan debt is that far too often servicers place these financially vulnerable Americans into costlier than necessary plans that are not sustainable over the life of the loan.

Student lending is the second-largest consumer finance market, right behind mortgages, and roughly $620 billion more than the total U.S. credit card debt. It‚Äôs hard to overstate just how enormous this issue really is.
https://studentloanhero.com/student-loan-debt-statistics/

Currently, student loan debt has grown to over $1.3 TRILLION in the United States, weighing down 44 million Americans, with more than 8.5 million people presently in default.  This is a significant and growing problem a vast array of Americans are facing.
